lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to Critical Role, the show where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors get together, roll dice, and play Dungeons and Dragons. My name is Matthew Mercer, I'm the Dungeon Master of the game. Welcome, new folks who haven't seen this before, hope you're not too lost, and returning Team Hooman and Critter fans, welcome back, we love having you and let's get this evening on the road. We have some announcements and things to talk about before the game actually kicks in, so we'll first pass it over here to our fantastic overlord to get that kicked off.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: That's right, you get to see my ugly face for a couple minutes while I get through a couple quick announcements, guys. A lot of you have been asking me on Twitter and in the chat room when you will get to see Critical Troll? That will be up on the website tomorrow night at 8PM Pacific Standard Time. So go over to the website at 8PM, you'll be able to see that and I'm sure you guys will secretly pass around the youtube link and stuff.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Currently you can find Laura's article on GeekandSundry.com.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Which is apparently the name, D&Diesel.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Hashtag D&Diesel. That will be showing tonight during the midpoint of the show. Now, there's a couple special things with this showing, you need to watch it live. If you think that you're going to come back later, watch it on the rebroadcast, and you're gonna go dip out for a pee break or pizza break, whatever, don't! Stick around because after it shows tonight live, you will be unable to see it again until Monday on the website. So it will be cut from the rebroadcasts.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: I'm really sorry about that, but that's just unfortunately how PR deals work sometimes and that's just the way it is. But, it'll only be--

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Yeah, it'll only be a few days and you'll get to see a lot more on Monday. A longer cut and that's why it's a website exclusive. It's longer, it'll have some tightening and all sorts of other stuff. But, you guys get a special treat tonight with a preview showing, and it's still a long preview, it's like 20-25 minutes or something like that.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: So there's that. Tomorrow we have a very special event happening for all of those that joined us for the Extra Life campaign, thank you so much, and a lot of you guys were here as well.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: And thank you for donating, getting us well past our goal, and as some of you may remember during Critical Troll, Felicia mentioned that if we reached a certain goal, she would come on, on a scheduled date and play Rock Band 4. So that's happening, tomorrow.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We are having a battle of the bands from 5 to 7PM Pacific Standard Time, and Mr. Mercer here is going to be playing the drums.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I'm drumming for them, which, first off, I haven't played since probably 2011, and I'm a little rusty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, but I assume they're gonna destroy me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. I will narrate my failure.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: And there's been a Twitter battle happening between the two teams.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: You're kinda walking into the fire, my friend.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Felicia's put a lot on the line for you guy's team.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's cool. I got fire resistance. That's fine.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Okay cool, cool. That'll be happening tomorrow 5PM to 7PM Pacific Standard Time, you guys should tune in for that. We are still going to be donating to Extra Life, but we're not really going to be pushing it, it's more of a reward for you guys for helping us get past that $75k goal.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Our next giveaway is going to be at 9,500, we're getting pretty close. The other real quick little announcement I have as far as subs go, is last week you guys were able to get our sub train up to 420 subs, now that counts resubs and new subs. So we have the sub train going right now, I believe it's well over a hundred--

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: If we break last week's record of 420 which I think they purposely stopped at 420--

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Hey guys, don't go. We will do a giant giveaway of board games, D&D stuff signed by the cast, signed by the rest of the Twitch crew. We'll throw in a couple video games, t-shirts, all sorts of stuff. Plus Ivan has said if we reach that goal for TPK, which those that watched last Monday, thank you so much.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Last week, some of you saw the Twitch cast leave me for dead outside of the studio. And a lot of people thought that I might come back if given the opportunity. Well, if we break that sub goal, Ivan has said that I will come back and probably wreak havoc in some way for our Twitch host that thought they could get away with leaving me for dead in the middle of the street.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We like to pride ourselves at Geek & Sundry for being a very open and loving and warm community, and that's absolutely the most important thing to us and to Felicia and to a lot of our viewers, and I know last week things got a little heated in the chat room, and we just want to remind everyone that we don't get the opportunity to talk to you much during the show, but we want to make sure you guys stay as positive as possible or I will have to throw the hammer down on you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know, just goes to say that this community is built on so many great, positive people and such a wonderful sense of community, and a big huge thanks and please share appreciation for our fantastic mods who work consistently and constantly throughout the day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Through our chatroom, which if you've watched, as you're now seeing and have seen previous episodes, is I can only assume readable by super mastermind computers at this point. So, you guys do an amazing job, it's really appreciated and to all of you guys out there in the community, keep that positivity, keep that understanding, and enjoy our game for its ups, for its downs, for our good character choices, bad character choices. It's all an experience in a story that we're all having together at the same time. So, kick along, hold on, and keep smiling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do. I love you. We do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a thing. So yeah, so, couple other announcements for you guys. What's our sub count right now? When's our next one hundred?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At 9,500 we will be giving away our signed photo and signed art piece by Kit Buss to a random person who's active in the chat. So next time we hit that goal, we'll have that giveaway, which is awesome. Once again, Extra Life has been our big charity push right now. Everyone who's given, thank you so much. So, so much, and if ever you want to be a part of helping that out we have the information there available for you, it goes to a really great cause. Let's see, Sam will be here shortly. Unfortunately, we're down a Tiberius tonight. However, yesterday was Orion's birthday, so feel free to go ahead and wish him a happy birthday on Twitter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Happy birthday, Orion. But yeah, Sam should be here shortly. And, let's see, do we have any project announcements?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or any other announcements you've got.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, yesterday I started directing for the World of Warcraft. So that's pretty good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it's gonna be ongoing and it was really nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I also want to thank Pupgames from Twitter for sending me this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look at this. It came in the mail separate and I have a hood and now I can just, you know, I can go like that and no one will see me so thank you, Pupgames.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let me set it here. I haven't figured out how to wear it exactly, but I will.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Take all your clothes off and then figure it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And then, I just want to take a minute, I said thank you on Twitter, but I just want to thank everybody who for the last week has sent me well-wishes and today who has sent me well-wishes, and a lot of the Critter community got together and made a video just to, you know, just support, support me in-- I am having a hard moment in my personal life, not gonna get into it, but you guys kind of took my breath away today for real. So, thank you very much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This whole community is brilliant, so you guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So many of them in New York and in San Francisco this week, where we've been all over the place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. Shout out to our New York and San Fran.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, in the same week. It's crazy. Yeah, we all went to New York Comic Con. We had a panel that went really well. We had a bunch of great critters come out and Team Hooman folks come and sit in the audience, ask questions. We had some fun banter back and forth. We gave out 'Critical Rolls,' these cookies that were our little meal deal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That were neither critical nor rolls, really to be fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Much like our realm is imaginary.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may have hit a couple people in the face, for which I greatly apologize.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I definitely hit somebody in the face with one of those rolls.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I like split someone's lip.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Her aim is excellent. She never misses.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we played golf. It was quite nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, thank you guys for coming out to that event. Also, for those who came to see us at Forbidden Planet in New York, we had a great turnout, and that comic shop wasn't quite expecting what they were in for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We weren't expecting, but they especially were like halfway through like, "Who are you "guys?! What is happening?!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We freaked out our Uber driver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We pulled up and got out of the car and all of a sudden it was like hundreds of people cheering and we all went "What?!" and the Uber driver went "What?!?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think his exact words is, "Is this for us?" (all laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And even we were like "I don't know."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys were amazing. Thank you for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we need to find and screen cap in the thread where we were like, 20, 30 people, guys. Let's not get our hopes up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that's who got back to me, was like, I don't know, 40ish.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we thought it was gonna be like 40 people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that was a good turnout.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That-- pretty great. Was great. Pretty great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Other announcements: Coming up in I think the next couple weeks or so, the release of the Minecraft Story Mode.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Comes out on Xbox. Completely a fun show. We went to the Archlight Let's Play of it they did, which was really a lot of fun. I play the characters Aiden and Otis in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, lots of screaming children. Yeah, so I play Aiden and Otis and a smattering of other characters throughout. I think Sam also worked on it. Anyone else?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, Ashley Johnson, our very own Pike!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she's one of the main characters in that show. So if you're a Minecraft fan and you like Telltale and you have an Xbox, check it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Speaking of Telltale, the final episode of Tales from the Borderlands comes out next week.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be wearing a costume. It'll be great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're in Minecraft, right? Story mode.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think we have a couple scenes together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or you're playing a version of me or something, I don't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can only assume that it's tawdry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) The director told me something about you and I just assume we're probably having sex in the game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just like an extended, fully interactive too. Talk about choices you make that affect the storyline. (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I blank out in the booth any time they mention his name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yeah, cool, guys. Any announcements anyone want to talk about, or shall we get things started?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, he'll be here in a minute but in the meantime, let's go ahead and dial in for the next episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. So. Sh. (laughs) So, to go over the current adventure in its current sequence, we have-- the party recently had an encounter with the Briarwoods. Two individuals that were responsible for a lot of strife--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were out for a political banquet with Sovereign Uriel in Emon and the party members of Vox Machina, they were all invited to be part of this. Didn't quite go as planned. There was a scuffle and the Briarwoods absconded back to Whitestone. They sent a couple assassins out to attempt to take out their driver, who was spilling information and essentially was going to be Vox Machina's way of being free of any sort of political issues based on their actions that evening, and after much discussion and preparation and purchasing a lot of mirrors, the party took their transit over to the east-northeast towards Whitestone, where they began to traverse the Alabaster Sierras to the north, using the mountain range as opposed to going directly through the forest. There they managed to avoid encountering a bunch of harpies that were distracted by eating the horses they left behind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They camped for the evening and began to make their way through some sort of a mountainous valley that led in towards the forest surrounding Whitestone. While they were traveling down this pass, there was a rumbling, and some sort of really fast, rapid-moving large blue creature that leaped down in front, catching them off-guard. And that is where we begin today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably should have fucking researched that creature.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did the creature look like that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, right? That would have been smart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That we didn't research that creature.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What did you roll on your beard check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd I roll on my beard check?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's metagaming, you can't. We're not allowed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And my Halloween costume requires a decent amount of facial hair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was a little worried about some performance capture coming up, but it got moved back--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so, everyone. As this huge, blue-scaled reptilian-like creature with multiple arms and legs comes skittering down the side of the cliffs, blocking off the entirety of this passage, snarling at you with sharp teeth and this sparking-blue electrical energy jutting out of the corners of its mouth. I want you all to roll initiative.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I add 20 to this, right, that's how it works?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't level up! What a dick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, you did but you didn't, is what you're saying?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, add your points right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's pretty hot. So many hit points for the barbarian.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And, if you want, you can just boost to, are you at 12 now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many spells does he get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of them. All right, so initiatives we have-- 25 to 20, anyone?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight! I consistently botch this roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: See you guys in like an hour. I got a four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you have consistently the best initiative rolls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah. I save it for when it counts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you should, as you should. So, first up: Percy. Instinctively, with your drive towards Whitestone and this creature in your way, you are already ready for this encounter. What are you going to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's bigger than sin, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is considered a huge creature.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so, I'm going to alert everybody, get down! And I'm going to take three shots--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're just going to start shooting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're just going to start shooting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just going to-- look at that thing!!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Percy gonna do what Percy gonna do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if you could reason with him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why doesn't it reason with me, is what I'm asking! It could reason with me!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a lot of heads in the way. Just aim true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm aiming, I'm going to use the Sharpshooter for extra damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will be less handsome with one ear, I'm just saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just go ahead and roll the attacks in succession.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll the attacks in succession so we know how many hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Second one, it hits, 18 plus seven.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For the third one, I'm going to go for a head shot instead of a Sharpshooter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, all three hit. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The dark cloud aids his rolls.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That went really well. The last one-- do I do any damage when I hit the head? Normal damage. So, last one is seven points of damage plus he's got--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage on his attacks this round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gotcha. Do you want to stay where you are, or are you going to move?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're right close to one. You can--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stop touching me. Stop touching me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'm going to brace against a wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'm going to mark all this off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Okay. Next up is the creature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (Laughs) Because it rolled really high on its initiative. It's going to go ahead. Let's see, at a movement of 50 feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispers) Are we in a valley? Or are we--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's going to be fine, guys. We're like a--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The valley is like a taco shell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a valley, or is it like those are cliff sides and we could fall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a valley. The cliff sides go up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's like a taco shell and we're the meat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it's pretty sheer. You'd have to make climb checks if you want to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lowers its jaw and rears its head back. As it does, you see its eyes flare with electrical energy and inside its mouth begins to glow with a brightish blue, white power.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A bolt of electrical energy comes forward, hitting Grog, Vax, Scanlan, and Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, let's see. Actually, no, it would move out to-- Hmm, that's only 20 feet, so to get maximum-- This, let's see.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe it doesn't do math well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't think about it, just go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe it doesn't know math well. Maybe it doesn't move right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't calculate it, Matt. It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --optimal impact here, instead, it's going to go there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have to put my head in its mouth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It will then do it on-- It would be Grog, Vex, and Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I realized that its bolt is only 20 feet long. So, utilizing its optimal Lightning Bolt length, you guys were clustered together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so I need you guys, you three, to roll a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With advantage because I'm in the mountains?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do it with advantage. It only affects attacks, not for saving throws.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's right. This is a magic save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oof, okay. 33 points of lightning damage to both of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't throw around the "D" word, unless it's the "D" word time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as there was a crackling of energy forward, you two brace yourself, managing to get mostly out of the way. Unfortunately, both of you dodging out of the way leaves an open shot for bear, that just takes the brunt of it, throwing Trinket up against the side of the actual mountainous cavern. And slumps to the ground, smoking off the fur.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does Trinket have to make saving throws?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No one has any resistance, spell resistance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet. Until we get to his turn. That will end--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Forgetting-- Your armor? I've got a spell you're--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to Hunter's Mark him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to Hail of Thorns him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog is always in the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do need a good back tickle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Grog) Got an itch back there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sighs) I'm so angry right now! Thorn's d--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's not at me for once.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For once, you're not the one doing damage to the bear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a bonus action, so we can do other shit if Scanlan and I both do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the damage. Okay, gotcha. And Grog, also--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're right next to it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (posh accent) Would that be considered piercing, bludgeoning, or slashing damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (posh accent) It doesn't matter, you have not taken your turn to rage yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be full damage upon you, Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, I'm sorry. The other one was 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. That's including the Hunter's Mark, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait no, that's a lie. That's a 15, 16, 17, plus five. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21, got it. So, as you look over and you see Trinket on the ground, smoldering spire of smoke pouring off of his body--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I pull him? Can I pull him out of the way?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just pull him into the little crevice, for my move.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For my move. Is that a move action, or would it be an action-action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be more of an action-action, unfortunately.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you angrily turn around, release your arrow, firing a completely furious Hail of Thorns into the creature. As it hits, it shatters across its hide, some of it scattering onto Grog. You don't even care. You just focus the anger, pull out a second arrow, unleash this one. Actually jamming underneath one of the scales. You can see a little trickle of dark, deep purple blood beginning to pour from the wound.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get out of the line.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, where do you want to go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I still want to be near Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That ends your turn. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Getting ass-lit up with the Hail of Thorns, I go into a rage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go into a Frenzied Rage!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I would like to attack three times with my flaming warhammer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I missed a box.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. 17 and 18, 19, 20, 21 plus the fire damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so, going into the rage, you just see that same fury. You can smell the burnt hair in the air and you use that to fuel that moment of pain. You just (impact sounds) and just start bludgeoning the creature right up in its face. You can see it's thrashing and snarling at you and snapping with each blow. You guys are locked in this titan-versus-human battle right now. Cool, and are you going to stay where you are?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to move. Can I move towards you a little bit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, staying next to him, but just out of the way of other projectiles that might be coming up my butthole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fair enough. (laughs) Okay, Grog. Ends your turn. Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'm right next to Trinket, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's right there. You're over here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go ahead and go to Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's right. Make a death saving throw, by the way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He'll be fine. He'll be fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roll like your bear depends on it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You should pick a blood-colored one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why would you do that? He rolled a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so not creeping closer to death yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to go ahead and do a Cure Wounds spell on him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Trinket's not worth second level?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wake him up, wake him up, wake him up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You guilted her up to another level.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Guilted it for an imaginary bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Trinket's at 25 hit points, conscious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then, as a bonus action--

lines.name: MARISHA
