lines.text: Does it look like there's a central part where there's a lot of people gathered?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Farmlands look likely to be the largest cluster of people. You can see, since it's getting to the end of the day, there are folks finishing up gathering the crops that were available to them or sort of planting as they go through. And you can see there's about five or six people that are all in one group. Most everyone else seems to be relatively solitary and trying to go about their business as fast as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's eight bodies hanging from the tree, and nobody wants to be there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. I'm going to swoop down and find a tree, where the five or six farmers are, and perch, see if Scanlan can get a good--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There actually are no trees by the farm, all the trees have been cleared out to make the farmland. So there's actually a bit of the forest that's been cleared for that purpose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You can go to a tree that's nearby, but that's like 300 feet away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A rooftop? A wall? Anything I can perch on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a wall. There is a wall on the outskirts of Whitestone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You swoop down and you perch on the edge of the wall there. It's about 25 feet up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just going to walk down there. I won't be able to see you, so I'm going to leave a little--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll keep an-- Oh, wait, I can't see you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you can't talk right now, you're an eagle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I leave a little, like a canteen or something, right where she's perched, just so I know where to find her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, my stein. And then I'm going to walk down and see if I can stealthily eavesdrop on some conversations.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You make your way down the 25-foot wall she's perched on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit. Am I going to fall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an athletics check to climb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. The stonework here is old and you manage to not lose your footing entirely as you bring your way down. Thankfully, you're light enough, and the stones are not too large, so you can get some good handholds. You do, over the next 12 minutes or so, make your way to the base of the wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It took me 12 minutes to climb 25 feet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe whistle for me when you come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But, you catch yourself. I mean, you can just jump if you wanted to make it less. But, the duration of your invisibility-- you have about 20 more minutes before it dissipates.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit, I have to do this quick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like there is a general sense of frustration that the land itself is not producing quality crops. And even the people look unhealthy and gaunt by nature. Whether it be the cold winter recently or just their general spirit is broken, but there is a feeling about these people that life here is not what it used to be. There isn't a whole lot of conversation, there's mutterings here and there. "We have to make sure we get these back in time. Fill the cart, we have two carts we have "to get in." And the other one's, "I know, I know, I'm trying," And they're putting it over there and there's a little bit of frustration among them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them ends up counting the last bit of crop. "That's it, that's all we have. That is the "entire pull for the day." And the older gentleman, who is overseeing it, grinds his hands and goes, "Sir Kerrion is going to have my hide."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, wasn't that one of the people--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "At the very least, let's gather it together and hopefully Pelor will protect us." And the people take the carts and begin making their way towards the outer gate on the southeast side of Whitestone, where you guys are currently at.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to hustle back to the roof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Make an athletics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hopefully he lands on his lute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. 15 minutes. After five minutes of eavesdropping you realize that you are not going to make it up that wall, and you feel the magic of your Invisibility illusion about to fade. At this point, by the way, the sun has just hit the edge of the mountains, the sky itself is a vibrant, reddish orange slowly turning to purple and sunset is upon you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to spend the night here. No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will sneak around the corner a little bit, wait for an opening, and I lose Invisibility, which will drop it on her as well, and I will Dimension Door back up to the roof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you pass to the side, the illusion fades, you step into a small opening of dark, purplish energy and then reemerge on the top of the wall--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and hop back on the back of her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Okay. You guys vanish, and Keyleth, you take off back in the direction you guys traveled from. In the meantime, guys, what do you want to have been doing? Are you just waiting, are you traveling further in, are you staying where you are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, keeping an ear out for the wolves and just chilling in a tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (yells) I fall out of the tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And also, I'm restringing my new, awesome bow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which, by the way, is a longbow of sky sentinel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sky sentinel, what does that mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Once per long rest, I can use a Storm Arrow, which means that the next arrow I fire splits into three arrows. Roll an attack for each of them, they all get 1d6 extra for each one that hits. It's amazing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Every time you use it, or is at a one-time--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's one time per long rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once per day, she fires an arrow and the arrow splits into three, and each one bursts into thunder damage, bursts of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Say what?! So, is it lightning damage or is it--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thunder damage. It should say on there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, then it would be lightning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, the night falls and the crickets begin to emerge, the slow mist begins to form.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, our friends aren't back yet. It's already night and they're not back?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just want to say that I pulled my hood down, and put on my calamari hat, and pulled the hood back over it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you take the partially rusted over, but functional, metallic skull cap that Clarota was wearing when you guys met in the Underdark, that Clarota no longer needs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You place it on your head and it's a little loose. As you place it on, it rattles for a moment, and then it form-fits to your skull. Your hair being pinched beneath it and just emerging from underneath, almost Loki-helmet-style.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a weird buzzing vibrational feel as its magic attunes to you over the next hour or so as you're waiting, but you get the sensation that it will offer some decent protection from impeding charm effects.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like you have a mullet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A Loki mullet. You start to get really nervous about the arrival of your friends, until eventually you hear the flapping of wings. You look up and you can see, since it has taken an hour to get there, the illusion just fades, both a giant eagle and Scanlan appear in the moonlight, right above the canopy of the forest you guys are close to, and return to the place you were.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth, question. Can you make it look like we're not here with your foliage shit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I drop my Beast Shape, holding onto a branch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we camp up in the tree? So nobody can come towards us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And, as usual, light some sage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes about an hour or so, but you manage to pull from the surroundings these really nice, thick spider silk hammocks, that should be able to support your respective weights. Grog is the only one that might be questionable with the sheer amount of weight that is his form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe take a rope and tie it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope, this is a trust exercise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm using Hide in Plain Sight to make me and Trinket extra, extra hidey.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a question. The only reason I have this question is because I posted that video from a couple of years ago. Do I still have the unending rope?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have the unending rope, motherfucker.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't we reinforce with the rope?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't like the trust exercise?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's where all the rope comes from that we ever use.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry I brought it up. I'd love you to fall on your head.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whoa, Vax. Nice helmet. Don Quixote called.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before we slumber, we did a little intel, a little recon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Turns out the town is full of humans, except for these six vampire giants-- zombie giants.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They all appear to be fairly miserable people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: However, this could be useful. Everyone in the town, the farmers anyway, seem to be gathering produce to deliver to the Briarwoods. We could pose as some sort of farmer troupe with a basket of goodies, and maybe get through the front gate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you think they would know all the farmers around at this point? They've been there for a long time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, they referenced Sir Kerrion, Percy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could make ourselves look like some of them. One of us has a hat of disguise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, there was something other really important.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The town was pretty much empty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And that Sun Tree, that what's-his-name-- Who said that? Jarett?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Desmond. Looks like there were some executions that took place. There were about eight bodies hanging from that tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why is it called the Sun Tree?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's really lovely. I don't know, maybe it gets sun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. Why do they call it the Sun Tree?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I go with this? Unless you have a particular reason to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you can go with-- There are maybe many reasons it's called the Sun Tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's reasons. Maybe we need to battle them at the Sun Tree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Legends say that before the castle was built, that the journey into the valley was treacherous and stormy, and the original builders of Whitecastle feared they would die. And this one, great tree stood in the valley, and it was underneath it that they took shelter. And as they began to take shelter, the storm broke. And the storm did not return until the castle was completed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We hold our festivals there every year.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And now it's being used as a--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it get a lot of sun?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That could help us, because vampires hate the sun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why would they make camp in the place where the god of the sun--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe that's why they're hanging bodies from it, to taint it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe that's why it's protected. Maybe--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are any of us religious with that god, or--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we call Pike through your magic poo?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would she be able to hear us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can at least see what she is up to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth, would you be able to revive the tree?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. Bring up the god of the sun again, I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not religious people. We can't summon the gods willy-nilly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't tell us what we can and can't do, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, let's go in the middle of the vampire-infested town and do some arbory to try to heal the tree, and then we'll just say, oh, sun god, please rain down sun here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it. Let's do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we at least try cutting down the bodies and running, and seeing what happens?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say, in the morning we take a look at the passage, see how well-guarded it is. And if it looks dangerous, sneak our way into the town. If people are not enthralled, if they are being forced to work, then maybe we can find some allies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think they're terrified. And I don't want to let them know we're here, for fear they'll turn us in, in hopes of saving their own necks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I'm thinking. Yes, they're terrified, but this whole town's being ruled by fear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a feeling we can revive that tree somehow. It may weaken the Briarwoods' hold on the psyche of the villagers here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is true! It could help out. Let them know the god of the sun is on their side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I heard you're supposed to pee on a lemon tree, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably you and Scanlan are on that, I have a feeling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I make a nature check to see if that's true?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I really wanted to ask. What does peeing on a lemon tree have to do with anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of them, generally, didn't seem to, over time, react well to the process, whether it be the fact that you all drank a lot of the time, so the content of your urine was probably not very hospitable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a whole different kind of festival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for bringing the text chat all the way back around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The lemon party is held on the far, far southern continent of Tubgirl, the region of Goatse.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have an idea. Should we wait until the sun comes up, create a distraction, so all the undead giants come looking, and then we have someone go cut the bodies off the tree, and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And bring it back to life!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- let Keyleth give it a little love.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then what happens after that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. It's an experiment, all right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then we get the fuck out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Won't they know we're here? Won't the people see us doing things?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. I feel that's the equivalent of putting dish soap in the fountain on prom night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! Didn't you say that all around the Sun Tree nobody's there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Didn't you say nobody's around the Sun Tree?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true. But we still have to get in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll fly up and over. You just did the same thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fly up and over, land, bring the tree back to life, get out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you sure you don't want me to be a carriage driver, and you'll hide in the hay of my carriage and I'll go straight up to the Briarwoods.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like they know all the townspeople.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will put on my hat of disguise, I will be someone completely different.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm telling you, they looked right through me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So while he was transparent, they saw through him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but I was heavily stealthed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the invisibility faded when he attacked the guard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When I beaned the guard. They should not have been able to see me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not talking about getting past the Briarwoods. I'm talking about getting past the guards that guard their castle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here's another issue. It's going to take me a minute to do the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I mean, it's one of those things where the longer I do it the better it'll be. I can do it for up to eight hours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I do it for up to eight hours, I enrich the land over half a mile radius, centered on a single point, and the land becomes enriched for a solid year.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to enrich all of the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Question. What time was it when they were doing their little scouting thing they've just told us about? The sun was going down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they probably would've gotten to Whitestone around seven o'clock, and leaving right as the sun had fully set.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we go right when the sun goes up--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, we get there at sunrise, take those fucking beasts out, and you start at eight AM.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just sneak in. Here's the thing. I don't know if you want to get all the crops all fancy, because it'll just feed the Briarwoods. Maybe just do the tree area, which will be like two hours, maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah? I think if I have a solid hour or two hours with it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Once the tree is healed, we have no one of religious power to summon any god. We don't know anything about this god, none of us do!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do, in theory, if I'm from--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a religion check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? Okay. Pelor is the god of the sun and agriculture. It's a good deity and is generally worshipped by farmers and simple folk and people that live off the land, and generally it's the most nature-based deity of the main spectrum, outside of Melora, which is the deity of nature.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Well, dope! Would I know stuff like that too, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know of Pelor, yeah. There are elements of Pelor's following that bleeds into your druidic nature, though you don't necessarily follow a deity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You believe that the essence of nature in itself is your patron.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are not a religious man by nature, and you know that there is a strong following of Pelor in the town. The entire graveyard that you talked about earlier, that one is largely built around the imagery of Pelor. And of all the gods that are worshipped here, Pelor's probably 75% of the population of Whitestone where, in some shape or form, if not devout worshippers, at least were like, yeah, Pelor's cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here's my question. I feel Pike's energy tonight. Maybe, while I'm meditating, I can somehow reach out to her, and maybe ask her to get in touch with Sarenrae, and maybe Sarenrae can call up her homeboy Pelor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is like phone a friend?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're not organized religion people, we Ashari.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me? I am the antithesis of faith.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then you need to shut up and let us fix that tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to fight off a million monsters to heal a tree, and then we're going to say, "Okay. Bring out the sun," or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on! What did you just say?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That thing you just said that no one heard because we were all shouting and arguing? Rally the townsfolk?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Rally the townsfolk. This is something I think-- I don't think that sneaking in is necessarily the answer. I'm not saying go in, guns blazing, but I say we let them know--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want to build a militia?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to build a rebellion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it. They would recognize you, wouldn't they, Percy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does it involve healing the tree?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think there is any sneaking in, thanks to those birds, so we make a stand out here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My plan is, we do our best to sneak in, we find cover. Obviously, you said there's abandoned buildings. We find cover. We heal the tree. I have some other ideas. We take those zombie giants out one by one, quietly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shh! Let him finish the plan!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like Attack on Titan. That's cool!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We let them know we're back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like having the people. It feels less like we're the United States.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have some parchment. I have the thing I want to build, while I'm in the tree. It's very simple, and I want to show you what it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to take some gunpowder and basically--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Basically attach it to a piece of parchment. I want to wet it into a piece of parchment and let it dry so that when I set fire to that piece of parchment, I get a burn scar. I'd like to create a burn scar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a tinkering check, just for the sake of a possible epic failure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it'll scar anything. It just creates a very high heat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While the rest of you end up taking your evening's rest, Grog, you immediately snap your hammock and fall 15 feet to the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you manage to make your way up there and just bear hug the tree trunk for rest. You're used to sleeping in uncomfortable situations.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I throw five or six pine cones at his head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about seven, 7:30 in the morning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I do a quick scry back to the poo jar that I left back in our kitchen?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just to make sure that our home base is okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It appears to be a couple of your various employed mercenaries having a conversation as she's making breakfast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I knock that one off, and I'll try for Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather, due to the relatively fresh and unstable nature of this potion you had concocted, you can only have one source connection up at a time, so when you left it in your keep, it seems that the one you had at the temple of Sarenrae was alleviated of its magical presence. What was once a magical scry poo is literally just Scan-scat at the temple.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which some could argue is magical in its own right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure enough. With a high enough persuasion roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it change color when it loses its power?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn it! I want to know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Only one way to find out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ask Pike when you see her again. (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go find an abandoned building and set up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could we throw in a Scanlan grenade and be able to see through it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could get in, shit in their bedroom, and leave.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You shit in your hand, and you toss it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could fly overhead with Keyleth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then we'd have eyes in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I like this a lot. Give me something to eat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a sweet potato right here, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sweet potato? That's good, yes. Some prunes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. We're off the rails.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About another hour and a half of travel before you start getting to where the trees begin to clear up a little bit, and you can see the base of the cleared-off mountain that Whitestone Castle is built upon, and the pathway that descends into the outer wall of the city of Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How far of a travel is it down into the city?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we can do that a little amount of time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there, and this is the mountain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So if we're going to try stealth this shit in--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we take the stealthy one or the invisible one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. Wait. Which plan are we doing first?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: First part is getting an abandoned building.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that we can be near the tree to protect you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So that we can be townspeople.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So you can get a beret.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So who goes and finds the abandoned building?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which is why I'm going to be wearing-- I haven't been seen in years, and when I was seen, I was much younger, and honestly--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, but the Briarwoods knew who you were.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had different hair. Yes, they do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But they're not on sentry duty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We need a forward operating base, so who wants to be stealthy or invisible and find an empty building?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Question: for the Assassin path of rogue, at 9th level, if I have seven days, which is way too much time, I can impersonate anyone I want. In half a day, could I just be a dirty nobody?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You'd be able to disguise yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Perhaps Percy should wear the hat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just a few minutes, I think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, you had it from the dinner party.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've been trying to think of what sorts of buildings would be the most defensible and the least likely to arouse suspicion. Things with basements?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A lot of the houses have basements. There are varying degrees of it. There are larger homesteads that were reserved for the actual nobles that ran the day-to-day life of Whitestone when your family was in power. As you heard from Desmond, probably the places where the new nobles live. Those are the ones that have the gates surrounding them: the larger homesteads scattered throughout the town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's far too obvious. There are many small abodes and even some farm-based hovels. The poor end of town is the farming side, which is the southwest, which is the closest area to where you guys made your stop earlier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The shopping district is the center of town around the town square.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not going to be there for long.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have food rations. We have options.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We might be there for days and days.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We also have to go around town and, forgive me if I'm going too far with your plan here, but aren't we trying to win allies among the people?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on. Drop your pants and get with the plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it? Have we gone to sleep, or are we waking up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are awake. After this discussion, I'd say it's about 8:00 in the morning. 8:30.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we doing the tree thing right now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. We try to get in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We find a place to at least set up our operation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, that's what I was going to say. Do we want to find operations, try and recoup--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't really know what we're going to find this morning. Those big guys could still be there; we don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't know if there are people in the pocket of the Briarwoods here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we take a day to get in and get settled, I can do a Heroes' Feast and then I start crack of dawn in the morning?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that's a good idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get in and set up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hole up. Let's find a place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, we're just going to walk into the city?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we're going to stealth into the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to cast Pass Without a Trace on everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. (laughs) Your beard is pretty much at the fullest it'll ever be. You gather you can probably get a little more thickness to it, but your beard is at maximum, Grog. The fact that you even have a goliath with a beard is a feat of magic in its own right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it like that Vidal Sassoon commercial? Whip it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, I've heard that no one in this town wears a beard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can forget it. I won't go in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys are traveling as a group. I need stealth checks from everybody.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have Pass Without a Trace?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we each take a little bit of time to look more like commoners?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I rub dirt all over my face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You should try to look less handsome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we do look like quite the motley crew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you roll a natural 20, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys rolled natural 20s in stealth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Had a little help with Luck, but I got it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's really good, because I rolled a one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got Pass Without a Trace, so 28.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we all going together? Are we not sending one person in to go find an empty building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still a few half-elves, a gnome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Outside of illusion magic, you're still going to stick out like a sore thumb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could we cast illusion magic? Do we have it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm walking 50 feet in front of everybody else.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seeming! To make Grog and Trinket look like commoners.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm 50 feet in front of everyone else.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. All right. I will cast Seeming on us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a legit use of Seeming, too. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As opposed to the cows? Come on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he'll just be a really drunk peasant.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I just say this? Can we just leave Trinket behind--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't want to walk in there with a bear!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He'll look like a fucking donkey, or he'll look like another commoner.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think I can only make us all look the same.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then he'll look like a fucking commoner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of similar size. I believe, as far as Seeming is concerned-- If not, then I'll allow it for the purposes of this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not leaving a fucking bear on the outside of town where there's hounds around, and there's fucking vampires and birds flying around, fuck you!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, wait, no! You can give each target a new appearance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I can make everyone look a little different.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Each creature can seem a foot shorter or taller, or appear thin, fat, or in between.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Make him look like a milk cow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't change their body type. So, Trinket will still be a four-legged creature, but you can make him look like a different four-legged creature.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Real talk, real talk, Scanlan. My sister will cut you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Donkeys can move more quickly. This is true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Trinket takes on the form of a donkey.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) So are you darling, so are you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you are a smattering of various humanoids, you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I make myself look like a weird hunchback, sort of, not all there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you guys look like pretty rough peasants, dirty faces. You know, hair a little razzled. It looks like you've been living the harsh life on the outskirts of the slums of Whitestone for quite some time--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I wanted to be a model.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. You guys, utilizing your stealth checks and the Seeming, you make your way up to the-- which side of Whitestone are you coming in from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all are unfamiliar to the denizens of Whitestone--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you are noticed, and some people seem to just stop and watch you pass, but no one seems to make any active mention, note, or change in behavior towards it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we checking buildings while we're walking through?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have passive perception of 21; I'm always looking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk over to just one random person on the street and say, anyone hiring hands? On farms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Make a deception roll. I'll give you advantage on it because the Seeming does give you the visual perspective of being close to their type.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a four-- No, hold on--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gonna use Luck, that's the Luck.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was the first number gonna be a 40?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That's two Luck rolls, by the way, that you've spent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The woman you approach who's probably in her early 30s, pale blonde hair, looks like she actually might be losing it in some places, gives you a look and goes, "You poor people shouldn't be here."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You'll find it, but you're not going anywhere else. Welcome to Whitestone." She turns around and walks back, joining arms with apparently a man that she's paired with, and the two of them just walk away, a bit dumbfounded that people walked into Whitestone. As this happens, you glance over your shoulder and you see coming from the northern edge from this side wall-- (sounds of booming footsteps)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we should avoid that shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A very tall, noticeably undead giant with its jaw broken off and hanging from the hinge, dried, caked blood across its chest, it's just dragging this large club behind it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are we? What are our surroundings right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You right now, you're in a T. To the right and left are roads that go along the inside of the wall that surrounds Whitestone, to the front of you is the path that leads further into the city.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wanna head through the city, possibly in the direction of the cemetery.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I wanna head in that direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys make your way through--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keeping an eye out for, you know, buildings that look clustered and abandoned that we can hide in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few buildings that look long-term abandoned, immediately in this area here, in the outskirts, catches your guys' eye. You do notice that the corner lamps that you had set up at the different corners of the streets appear to be shattered.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There would be like, you know, glass oil lanterns that at night someone would go around and light them after the sunset. The posts that hold them now are all either broken, or the glass itself has been shattered.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They want it to be really dark.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They want it to be really dark. I'm also thinking about that cemetery.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not gonna live in a cemetery, that's super creepy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As opposed to all of the other things we've done?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there any other abandoned buildings around?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As opposed to sleeping in the Underdark?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are plenty of buildings that look dark and mostly untouched in this section here, as you begin to move closer and closer inward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get east of the center square and set up camp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Where's the castle? Is it on the top of the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're trying to shoot for here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys move this way, as you push towards the center of this here. You--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You move past the center here and to the left of you, you can see the town square and there it is, the Sun Tree. Very, very large, you imagine beautiful tree at one time, full height was probably about 40 feet tall. The branches twist out, and almost look like they're hanging loosely, the ends, everything looks droopy and desolate; there's not a leaf on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do some sort of a check from a distance to see if I can recognize what kind of tree it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not indigenous to this land. The fact that it grew here means that either it was transplanted, or it was some sort of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you do see the silhouette of the eight figures slowly swaying from beneath the branches.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We continue on. Don't pay too much attention to it. Find a place to post up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you, if you do your nature-y spell from inside a building, does it still do the same thing or do you have to be next to the tree while you're doing it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So the way the spell works, I can do it one of two ways. I can do it instantaneously, essentially grow up a whole bunch of plants and brush and shrubbery around me, or I can wait and I can concentrate for a while and instill a plant with vibrant--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- life energy and heal the farmlands and it would stretch out for a really far radius.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm gonna probably wanna do more the second one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do it from inside a house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you guys want keep moving down this path, to go through the square, closer to the tree, do you want to go southward?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know, it's a central point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We avoid the tree a little bit and just keep going straight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're going this way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a larger building, isn't there? I can't see--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, I would say let's get a good look at the tree, let's walk by it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we're gonna walk by the tree?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look like it's no big deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not getting too close to the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are keeping on the outskirts of the square, it's hard to make out the details, and the weathering has muddled the figures that are hanging there. Percy and Vax, you guys notice the figure on the far left--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Immediately to the left of it you see what looks to be the body of a child. The child is dressed up in a purplish, billowing shirt, very fine silk shirt and pantaloons, and is dangling there next to it. To the left of that you see what appears to be a female, adorned in greens and browns, looks like red paint has been driven through the hair, and dangles to the left of that figure. Next to that, you see what appears to be--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am walking the fuck away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- you see what appears to be another woman, dressed in dark blacks and browns, leathers, some furs across the top, dark hair, dangling. To the left of that you see another man dressed similarly, dark greys and blacks, long dark hair, dangling. To the left of that you see a rather large man, older, rotund, probably in his forties, clothing padded but mostly open chest, hair completely shaven bald, it looks like there are dark scars placed across the face, hanging. To the left of that you see, this figure is actually not humanoid, you see what appears to have been--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- a recently hunted bear, who is dangling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They killed people they thought were us, or they killed--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or it's a message to us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they look like us or were they just dressed like us? Are they made to look like us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to get closer and look?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to get closer and look? Are you sure--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there anything around the tree other than us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there something at the base of the tree, is there anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can see now, nothing but just rocks and stones and piles of loose cloth rotting below it. Approaching, it looks like each one of these bodies has been dressed up. It looks like the color in the redhead's hair has been smeared through with paint. It looks like the person who has been painted red has been slapdash. You gather with a moment of looking at it that these were not individuals that were caught this way. This was set up as a message.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep walking, keep your head down and keep walking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean in town? Of course they are!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, remember they have to, like, be where the soil they came from is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, they have, like hideouts, they don't have to be where the soil they came from is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're in their keep, buried deep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's other buildings you see in the vicinity that, you know, look abandoned or for the most part unoccupied. I'd say about one in every three buildings looks like it's in disuse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did we see this big building right here as we walked by? Yeah, that big one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys came-- made this path-- you can see a little bit, you can see is a--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I should know what it is, anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- iron fence, it used to belong to one of the noble families of Whitestone. Each one of these large buildings here, these three, and you remember this, were the three families that ran the town.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have to stay as far away as humanly possible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question. You said there were eight bodies?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there one that looks like a gnome cleric and one that looks like a dragonborn sorcerer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There wasn't a gnome cleric one there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There was no cleric when we faced them before. All of us who stood against them in Emon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Body of my guy. Is he sort of handsome?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But, it does mean that it was because of when they saw us in Emon--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it was a child? Oh, god.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- because Tiberius wasn't here with the crows.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it was because of Emon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, can we get like a vague idea of how long these people look like they might have been here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Fuck, I'm not good at this shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. It would be advantage on that check for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21? You gather these bodies have probably been here for the better part of a week, week and a half? There is some mild decomposition starting to settle in, there is a bit of bloating to some of them. Couldn't have been much longer than that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A week? That's before we set out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why would they put a warning for us here in the city?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They assumed we would come, but they don't know that we're here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Those birds might have told them we were here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This was a week ago, this was before we were even close.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Going to go find something that's a decent distance away from the three noble households, that has a reasonable view of the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would probably be somewhere in this vicinity here, as the three main houses are right there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Something with a second-floor view, but with some distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) I'd say make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look out too, I've been on the lookout for a building the whole time!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I'll say, I'll say it takes the better part of the next hour or so, and you do a little bit of meandering to find it, you guys are being stealthy best you can through alleys and such, but even so you are out in the open, midday, but you are also, you know, under Seeming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like there's a covering nearby, roughly, 30 feet or so from the tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the tree is out in the center, and essentially the nearest building is probably anywhere from 100, 200 feet away from it. It's the tree out in the middle of the square, and the square, which used to have probably more things towards the center, more temporary establishments, have all been put to the sides and put to disuse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do manage to see what appear to be what was once a tavern or an inn of some kind that is silent, closed, the doors locked and chained. The windows look dusty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we sneak in the windows, so it keeps chained?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You go around the side of it, to the alley.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is where we're going to hole up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I kind of want to talk to the tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then go talk to the tree, Keyleth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, no, no, no, not yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What am I, stealthing right now, or checking for--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing your guys' stealth as your going, this would be your attempting to unlock the window.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, unlock, okay. So that's a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are, you can see, candlesticks set around that have not been lit for a while, and the oil lanterns that normally light the interior of the main tavern social area have been long in disuse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you guys want to look around. Are you all going in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You as well? Or are you talking to the tree?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does anyone want to come talk to a tree with me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't bring that-- don't mess with that thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, come with us. Keyleth, come with us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Once we do it, it's like ringing a dinner bell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, all right, all right, I'm coming, I'm coming.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm gonna look for a brothel! (all laugh)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's going to be the saddest brothel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find your way inside the abandoned tavern. And it is what was this giant L-shaped building, right here in the corner of the town square. There is a second floor, approximately runs 20 rooms. They are all currently unlocked, some of them left open, the bedding covered in dust, some of it looks like it was left in a hurry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find the cellar, and down there, there are a number of empty barrels, and a couple of ones that are still full.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One that appears to be a heavy whiskey barrel, probably about twenty untouched wine bottles. A little bit of ale, but it looks like a lot of ale was either completely used, or taken with whoever left and abandoned the premises.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we can definitely use these for explosions, if we need them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Muscle relaxers. Is there a view of the tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Going from a number of the rooms up top, not every room has a window, but it's like every third room on that side of the building does have a view of the entire square.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I get an eye as to how far away it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say probably about 200 feet? 250 feet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you go invisible and still talk to the tree?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can make her invisible if she can talk to the tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you talk to the tree if you're invisible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you cast a spell while invisible, unless it's Greater Invisibility, then it will drop the illusion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can burrow under, we can--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Actually, what are we up to right now? Are we doing anything? Are we busy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, there are windows on the first floor, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are some windows in the tavern; there was one on the second floor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're in the cellar, that's why I went to the cellar.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm gonna just find some old rags, or anything I can find, tablecloths, and just cover the windows.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But make it not obvious, because it doesn't want to look like we covered the windows.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've watched you pass through solid stone and earth. How long can you do that for?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I can burrow us a tunnel right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you get us close to underneath the tree?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what she's going to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to do it right now. I'm going to cast Move Earth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to start carving a tunnel--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To the direction of the tree. And I want to be careful, I don't want to damage the roots of the tree at all. So, as I start getting closer, I want to start looking for the roots of the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get them a little wet. There's no water here; all the water here has dried out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'll have to use the wine; it'll probably kill some of the bacteria. There are wells throughout the towns you see, ground wells that are set in the city. There is no nearby river. The closest river, the one you know about, is about a 30 minute walk south.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a bit of a ways.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's easy enough for you to go around and put cloth over the windows. It's a dark interior, so it's not like an immediate--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just so light doesn't leak out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not going down to the pre-made tunnel, I'll just keep an eye above ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am, too, I'm staying up in the tavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going with you to the tunnel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to tinker a little thing. Can I borrow an arrow?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. I'm going to tinker a very little, easy thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want the top floor, I'll take the bottom floor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to be able to fire and ignite one of the parchments on an arrow. So that I can--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want me to shoot the arrow for you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- set a burn mark at a distance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It would be a spark, as opposed to actual flame. It would just be concussive force.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, it's more getting the parchment there without it tearing or the arrow leaving it behind, because it is a thin, flimsy piece.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a really intricate-- go ahead and roll a tinkerer's check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You toy with it for a while; you think you have something that may work. You're uncertain as to on its release if it'll function or not. So, write down 'Parchment Delivery Arrow' with a question mark next to it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There might be, but just in case there's not, I want to make sure this works.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could always slap it up there and shoot it with a flame arrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got three of them, so I've got options. But I just want to make sure--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You continue to burrow through the ground, moving the earth aside and the tunnel opens before you like the clay slowly melting away. And it is wet earth. Eventually, you start getting to a few thick roots under the tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you talk to it from here, Keyleth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The roots that you see, they continue past the tunnel. They go very, very deep into the ground.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Awesome. I'm going to clear out a little more area, and I'm going to touch the roots and cast Speak with Plants.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The only superpower more pathetic than Aquaman's.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (kid's voice) Gee wiz, I wish I had some water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (kid's voice) The sun is so bright today!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Too bad we don't have Tiberius with us with his endless water fucking pitcher.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can go to one of the wells and get some water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's what fish say. Hi, Aquaman.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can bring it back. Should I?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm a druid, that's my-- yeah man!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can bring dead things back?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should I? Okay. But it's dead. What time is it now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Including the time you've spent inside the tavern, searching it through and preparing it as your base of operations.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should I start it up now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to start my Plant Growth. I'm going to drop. Can I try to clear out an area where I can-- I should be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to strap on my gloves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hope you guys are ready for this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it going to be loud?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's just going to take a long time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vax and I are guarding the tavern, so if anything comes--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to get provisions ready to spoon-feed her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Actually, before I do that, can we all have one last meal together and eat a Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you've made the purchase within Emon for how many of the requisite chalice for the Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a gem-encrusted bowl worth 1000 gold pieces, which the spell consumes. So, we'll say how many of those did you purchase in Emon, knowing you'd be casting this in the future?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much gold do we have?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that for each person, or 1000 gold for the whole party?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about you did three bowls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mark 3000 gold from the group's queue. And you have three gem bowls, using one now. So you have two bowls left at your disposal. And you prepare a Heroes' Feast for the group to consume.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take some of that leftover wine, use that to make it fancy wine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is great. This is awesome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we eating in the cellar?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you get, I believe, 2d12 additional hit points on top of your maximum hit points.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What the fuck is a d12? I've never rolled a d12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- 2PM tomorrow. So mark that down, somebody note that it lasts until 2PM.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And, you should have- Ooh! I got two tens!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket can also benefit from this, by the way, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. You are immune to poison, and diseases, and being frightened, and all wisdom saving throws are made with advantage. Feast is awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we do that right before we go see the Briarwoods, also?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Doing that right now, just in case the Briarwoods decide to come say hello.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or any of the other terrible people who live in this town because there are terrible people in this town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And disease and frightened. So, feast consumed, you now take your next eight hours--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go meditate. I'll be back in eight hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --to work on this. As she sits down to begin the ritual of cleansing, or bringing plant vitality enhancement to the vicinity of Whitestone. We're going to go ahead and end today's session there. Pick up at the end of that spell at the beginning of next week.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I love you all so much. I love you so much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was like eight in the morning-ish when we found that building, yeah?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Was it around eight in the morning when we got to that house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys got to town around nine, 9:30.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So the spell probably started around 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've also taken it slow, you're also being stealthy and not trying to be conspicuous as you move through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right, so we'll start the fight in the morning the next day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I'm meditating now. I dropped into my meditation--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not starting any fight, we're forming an insurgency.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have stuff to give you, too, 'cause, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for letting me roll with that, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course. It fit right into my--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had a funny feeling it would.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, guys. So we'll pick up from there next week, right in the center of the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A tree full of dead us? That's fucked up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was some mean shit, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what you call a giving tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And the tree was happy. But not really.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, no, so that was it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Well, I guess we have the announcements.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: And I wanna thank the chatroom for being on their best behavior tonight.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Not by me, anyway. There's always a couple trolls that find their way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's the internet. Trolls happen. But yeah, guys, thank you for being respectful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Guys, thank you, oh my god, I'm so happy to be sharing this.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: You know what makes you guys so awesome? Donations for charity! (all cheer)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Killer Penguin, another $20. Killer Penguin, always a good one. LoveMyMom donated $22.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, maybe the decimal place was wrong?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Emma came back with another $25 donation again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anonymous donated $35.10, anonymous, whoever you are, love you too.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We'll go back to the beginning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anna Law donated $25, thank you Anna. Well-played. Louis Lovelan donated $560. Louis. This community has so much people, so awesome.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: An interesting note, they said they wanted to donate $20 per episode, 'cause they just caught up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a lot! Lot of episodes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kash, yeah. Steven Duggan donated $5. Is that the Dugganator?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's Dugganator. Steven Duggan? Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Donated based on critical fails and natural 20s.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's kind of a cool way to do it. Guys, you're all continuously fantastic in your support for this community, for the charity causes that we put this out for, ever-humbled.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: See, Felicia was doing this thing where she was like, what team could I put together that will immediately win fan-favorite without doing any actual work? So we saw your plan, Felicia, and we came back with our team of Lucas, Mr. Spoopy in the back, running the tech board.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Augie, who is a professional drummer, Hector, and Amy Dallen, and we know, between Amy and Josephine, our chat room is definitely going to be split on who's the chat room favorite, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So is the professional drummer on bass?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: No. Definitely not. He is not on bass.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: He is not on bass. Lucas is able to play all songs on Expert on guitar, I think you guys are gonna have your work cut out for you. For sure.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: For sure. They also work here almost all week, and practice after all the shows. (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I prefer to light my opponents on fire while they're drumming, 'cause I find that's a good challenge for their skillset.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: It's for charity, let's just do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wanna say, we had a studio audience for this show as well, which we're very thankful for.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Come on up real fast. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Come on down here and say hello.

lines.name: ALEC
lines.text: What's up, Twitch chat? How you doing? These guys are exactly as awesome as you imagine them to be. I have to say, completely blown away. Absolutely blown away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seriously, man. Thank you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course, buddy. And guys, thank you all so much for tuning in. Hope you enjoyed it. We'll be back next week, Thursday. I guess we'll end here with a is it Thursday yet? Have a good night, guys.
